isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV) System, March 2007 and Later - SERVICE PROCEDURES FOR R-134a - ADDING REFRIGERANT TO THE SYSTEM

svcproc.title: ADDING REFRIGERANT TO THE SYSTEM
svcproc.para: Since the introduction of R-134a and the new PAG oil, relying on a sight glass clearing up when the system has a full charge is no longer reliable. DO NOT add refrigerant to the system in hopes of improving cooling. It's very possible that the system will be overcharged and cause component failure.
If it is found, during A/C system tests, that the system needs refrigerant; it will be necessary to perform the following procedures:

item.para:
and recharge the system, refer to CHARGING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM (FULL CHARGE)
.
